name: Fighter
description: Fighters are masters of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor. They excel in all forms of armed combat and can specialize in various fighting styles.

fighting_styles.Archery: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
fighting_styles.Defense: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
fighting_styles.Dueling: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
fighting_styles.Great Weapon Fighting: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
fighting_styles.Protection: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.
fighting_styles.Two-Weapon Fighting: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

Fighting Style.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

Weapon Mastery.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of Simple or Martial weapons of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can switch one mastery.

1.Second Wind: As a Bonus Action, regain Hit Points equal to 1d10 + Fighter level. Once per Short or Long Rest.

2.Action Surge: On your turn, take one additional action. Once per Short or Long Rest. Gain second use at level 17.

Weapon Mastery.description: You can use the mastery properties of one additional kind of weapon.

4.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.
4.Tactical Mind: When you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of Second Wind to add 1d10 to the check, potentially turning it into a success.

5.Extra Attack: Attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. Increases to 3 attacks at level 11, and 4 attacks at level 20.

6.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.
6.Tactical Shift: When you activate Second Wind, you can move up to half your Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

7.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Martial Archetype subclass.

8.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

9.Indomitable: Reroll a failed saving throw. Must use new roll. Once per Long Rest. Gain second use at level 13, third use at level 17.

Weapon Mastery.description: You can use the mastery properties of one additional kind of weapon.

10.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Martial Archetype subclass.

11.Extra Attack (2): Attack three times when you take the Attack action on your turn.

12.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

13.Indomitable (2 uses): Gain second use of Indomitable per Long Rest.

14.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

15.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Martial Archetype subclass.

Weapon Mastery.description: You can use the mastery properties of one additional kind of weapon.

16.Ability Score Improvement: Increase one ability score by 2, or increase two ability scores by 1.

17.Action Surge (2 uses): Gain second use of Action Surge per Short or Long Rest.
17.Indomitable (3 uses): Gain third use of Indomitable per Long Rest.

18.Subclass Feature: Gain a feature from your Martial Archetype subclass.

19.Epic Boon: Gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice.

20.Extra Attack (3): Attack four times when you take the Attack action on your turn.
